citation.article-title: Catenibacterium mitsuokai gen. nov., sp. nov., a gram-positive anaerobic bacterium isolated from human faeces.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Catenibacterium (Ca.te.ni.bac.te'ri.um. L. fem. n. catena chain; Gr. dim. n. bakterion a small rod; M.L. neut. n. Catenibacterium chain rodlet)
Fermentation products of glucose are acetic, lactic, butyric and isobutyric acids.
Cell wall contains an A1ùõæ-type peptidoglycan with an (L-Ala)-D-Glu-m-Dpm peptide subunit.
The G¬≠+C content of the DNA is 36-39 mol%.
The type species is Catenibacterium mituokai.
The genus Catenibacterium is a member of the Clostridium subphylum of Gram-positive bacteria and exhibits a close phylogenetic association with Lactobacillus catenaformis and Lactobacillus vitulinus.
